abstract: A status value that indicates whether this object can enqueue and render sample buffers.
overview:
## Discussion

If the status is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRenderingStatus/failed], check the value of the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVSampleBufferVideoRenderer/error] property to determine the failure. To resume rendering sample buffers after a failure, you must first reset the status to [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRenderingStatus/unknown], which you do by invoking [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRendering/flush()] on the video renderer.

This property is key-value observable.

# status

**Instance Property**

A status value that indicates whether this object can enqueue and render sample buffers.

## Declaration

```swift
var status: AVQueuedSampleBufferRenderingStatus { get }
```

## Discussion

If the status is [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRenderingStatus/failed], check the value of the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVSampleBufferVideoRenderer/error] property to determine the failure. To resume rendering sample buffers after a failure, you must first reset the status to [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRenderingStatus/unknown], which you do by invoking [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVQueuedSampleBufferRendering/flush()] on the video renderer.

This property is key-value observable.

## Inspecting the status

- **error**: An object the describes the error that caused the rendering failure.
